item.title: How to make message repeate it's self
item.dc:creator: @Tonic Tonic
item.description:
@Tonic wrote:

[quote="|Joshua|, post:13, topic:296999"][quote author=Tonic link=topic=393014.msg2927433#msg2927433 date=1251087585]

Like it matters for his server anyway… it’s probably another Delta with an already over-filled process. So don’t act like it matters… Please

Lol how was he acting cool? All he said was conventions were better…

I didn’t say he was acting cool. I just don’t like when people comment on my work when unless you are using a good source like RS2DV conventions don’t really matter. Yes it’s cleaner but when you look at it in the end why waste the time?

In my opinion for any source I would rather have it look cleaner.
[/quote]

It may look clean but it runs the same way it would even if it wasn’t following conventions.[/quote]

That’s awesome. I was just stating my opinion.

Read full topic

item.title: How to make message repeate it's self
item.dc:creator: @the_soul The Soul
item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

[quote="|Joshua|, post:5, topic:296999"]Just randomly saying codes… but try this anyways…

Declare this…

public int MessageTimer = 0;

Put this in boolean process

if (MessageTimer > 0) { MessageTimer--; }

Then also add this…

if (MessageTimer == 0) { sM("[FORUMS]www.yoursitehere.com"); sM("[VOTE]www.siteyouvoteathere.com"); MessageTimer += 10; }

Post errors.[/quote]

or just use the while loop

while(messageTimer > 0) messageTimer--;

Read full topic
item.source: How to make message repeate it's self

item.title: How to make message repeate it's self
item.dc:creator: @_Joshua1 |Joshua|
item.description:
@_Joshua1 wrote:

Just randomly saying codes… but try this anyways…

Declare this…

public int MessageTimer = 0;

Put this in boolean process

if (MessageTimer > 0) { MessageTimer--; }

Then also add this…

if (MessageTimer == 0) { sM("[FORUMS]www.yoursitehere.com"); sM("[VOTE]www.siteyouvoteathere.com"); MessageTimer += 10; }

Post errors.

Read full topic
